title: Antonietta's Bean Soup
introduction: Antonietta's Bean Soup, a delightful culinary creation, combines the rich flavors of Abruzzo with the heartiness of beans. Leveraging a classic rag첫 as its base, this soup offers a smooth texture achieved through milling or pureeing the beans. Enhanced with freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano and optionally garnished with green chile slices, this soup is a comforting and customizable delight.
ingredients: 2 cups Abruzzo-Style Rag첫, or another meat or tomato sauce
4 cups drained cooked dried or canned cranberry or cannellini beans
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
4 ounces spaghetti, cut or broken into 2-inch pieces
1 or 2 fresh green chiles, such as jalapeno (optional)
instructions: Prepare the rag첫, if necessary. Then, in a large pot, combine the rag첫 and water. Pass the beans through a food mill into the pot. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the soup is hot. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Add the pasta and stir well. Cook, stirring often, until the pasta is soft. Add a little more water if the soup becomes too thick.
Serve hot or warm. Pass the cheese and fresh chiles, if using, separately.
